intro: Platymiscium pleiostachyum, commonly known as the many-stemmed flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in diameter. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring, followed by elongated, woody pods containing flat, winged seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in tropical regions.
